headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Nvidia, Apple, Tesla, GM, Microsoft, CarMax, U.S. Steel, Warner Bros., and More
summary: Shares of Nvidia, Apple, and Tesla fall sharply Thursday after each stock soared double-digits Wednesday following President Donald Trump’s move to pause most reciprocal tariffs for 90 days. U.S. Steel, meanwhile, slumps after Trump says he wants the steel maker to remain an American company.

headline: Constellation Brands Blames Tariffs for Gloomy Forecast
summary: The Modelo beer importer anticipates earnings to weaken because of tariffs, and it sees sales slowing down the road.

headline: Modelo owner Constellation says Trump immigration crackdown hitting Hispanic customers
summary: Modelo Especial owner Constellation Brands' beer sales are taking a hit as demand from Hispanic populations in key U.S. states slows down amid Trump's crackdown on immigration, company executives said on Thursday.  President Trump has kicked off a sweeping immigration crackdown after taking office in January, ratcheting up pressures on the Hispanic consumers burdened by higher prices of food and other essentials as well as elevated unemployment rates.  Modelo Especial is made exclusively in Mexico, and is imported and marketed in the United States by Constellation Brands.

summary: Constellation Brands' Q4 results show steady beer sales, and stronger wine & spirits. Focus remains on distribution gains, innovation and marketing in beer.

headline: Constellation Brands's tariff outlook is weak but not 'draconian'
summary: Constellation Brands (STZ), the company that makes Corona and Modelo beers, is in focus after it announced quarterly results that beat on the top and bottom lines and issued a weaker-than-expected full-year outlook due to US President Trump's tariffs. The company also announced its agreement with the Wine Group to sell several of its wine brands. Roth Capital Partners senior research analyst Bill Kirk joins Morning Brief with Brad Smith and Madison Mills to take a closer look at Constellation Brands's earnings announcement. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Modelo Brewer Says Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Has Spooked Latino Shoppers
summary: President Trump’s immigration crackdown has spooked Latino shoppers.  Modelo Especial, an import from Mexico, rocketed past Bud Light to claim the top spot in 2023, but its sales are now slipping.  “If that consumer has concerns, issues, et cetera, that’s a big deal for us,”  Constellation  Chief Executive  Bill Newlands  said in an interview.

headline: Corona Beer Maker Talks Tariff Impact, Issues Conservative Outlook
summary: Constellation Brands Inc (NYSE:STZ) reported fourth-quarter earnings on Wednesday. Its net sales grew 1% year over year (Y/Y) to $2.16 billion, beating the analyst consensus estimate of $2.13 billion. Net sales for the Beer segment remained flat Y/Y at $1.70 billion, and Wine and Spirits rose 11% Y/Y to $459.8 million. Shipment volume for Beer fell 1.8% Y/Y, while Wine and Spirits rose 3.5% Y/Y. Gross profit increased 7% year over year to $1.11 billion. The company reported an operating loss of

headline: Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) Reports Quarterly Net Loss of US$375 Million
summary: Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) reported a challenging fourth quarter with a substantial net loss, contrasting their increase in sales and revenue from the previous year. This occurred as major financial markets, including the Dow and Nasdaq, saw significant rallies, driven by President Trump's tariff pause announcement. Despite these developments, Constellation's stock movement was relatively flat over the past week. These financial results and market trends suggest a complex landscape where...
